traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Beast
traits.text: A creature similar to an animal but with an Intelligence modifier of –3 or higher is usually a beast. Unlike an animal, a beast might be able to speak and reason.

traits.name: Fiend
traits.text: Creatures that hail from or have a strong connection to the unholy planes are called fiends. Fiends can survive the basic environmental effects of planes in the Outer Sphere.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still calculate damage using Strength.

ability.name: Kiss
ability.text: The vargouille kisses an adjacent creature that's asleep, paralyzed, or unconscious, exposing it to the vargouille transformation disease.

ability.name: Shriek

traits.name: Auditory
traits.text: Auditory actions and effects rely on sound. An action with the auditory trait can be successfully performed only if the creature using the action can speak or otherwise produce the required sounds. A spell or effect with the auditory trait has its effect only if the target can hear it. This applies only to sound-based parts of the effect, as determined by the GM. This is different from a sonic effect, which still affects targets who can’t hear it (such as deaf targets) as long as the effect itself makes sound.

traits.name: Concentrate
traits.text: An action with this trait requires a degree of mental concentration and discipline.

traits.name: Visual
traits.text: A visual effect can affect only creatures that can see it. This applies only to visible parts of the effect, as determined by the GM.

ability.text: The vargouille shrieks, its scream so terrible that all non-vargouilles within 60 feet must succeed at a DC 16 Fortitude save or be paralyzed for 3 rounds. The effect ends early for a creature if the vargouille moves out of sight, moves farther than 60 feet from the creature, or attacks the creature with its fangs. After attempting its save, a creature is immune to that particular vargouille's Shriek for 24 hours.

affliction.name: Vargouille Transformation

traits.name: Disease
traits.text: An effect with this trait applies one or more diseases. A disease is typically an affliction.

affliction.context: Exposing the victim to sunlight or any light spell of 3rd level or higher pauses the progression of the disease until the victim is no longer in light

stages.name: Stage 3
stages.text: victim's ears grow into leathery wings, tentacles sprout on the chin and scalp, and the teeth become long, pointed fangs (1 day)

stages.name: Stage 4
stages.text: victim's mind regresses to a vicious and unintelligent shell of its former self (1d6 hours)

stages.name: Stage 5
stages.text: victim's head breaks free of the body (which dies) and becomes a new vargouille

traits.name: Poison
traits.text: An effect with this trait delivers a poison or deals poison damage. An item with this trait is poisonous and might cause an affliction.

stages.name: Stage 1
stages.text: Damage the victim has taken from vargouille fangs can't be healed magically. Once all vargouille fang damage has been healed nonmagically, the poison ends.
